intro: Trichoscypha buettneri, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical rainforests of Central and Western Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of white flowers that appear in late winter or early spring. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, with smooth, grey bark and large, simple, ovate leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds, and the tree is known for its ornamental value due to its showy flowers and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
